title: Pope Reveals He’s Working on Secret ‘Mission’ of Peace in Ukraine
description: Francis said he was doing “all that is humanly possible” to help return Ukrainian children taken to Russia and urged Hungary not to slam doors on migrants.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Inside Ukraine’s Trenches
description: Also, the potential for civil war in Darfur.

title: Gas Shortages Force Cuba to Cancel May Day Parade
description: Severe fuel shortages have forced Cuban authorities to cancel the International Workers’ Day parade set for Monday in the capital.

title: Freya, the Walrus Killed by Norwegian Officials, Is Immortalized as a Sculpture
description: The bronze sculpture depicts the walrus on her side and should remind onlookers about the importance of coexisting, the artist said.

title: As Hospitals Close and Doctors Flee, Sudan’s Health Care System Is Collapsing
description: The medical professionals who remain face meager supplies and harrowing conditions, even setting up field hospitals in living rooms amid the fighting.

title: Blue Check Confusion
description: Why Twitter changed its account verifications.

title: Biden Praises ‘Absolute Courage’ of U.S. Journalist Detained in Russia
description: In a speech at the annual White House Association Correspondents’ dinner, the president said his administration was “working every day” to secure the release of Evan Gershkovich.

title: Mystery Gas Leak in Punjab, India, Leaves at Least 11 Dead
description: Officials had not yet been able to identify the gas or the source of the leak in the city of Ludhiana, in Punjab State.

title: Many in U.K. Greet King Charles’s Coronation With a Shrug
description: Images of the new king may be blanketing Britain, but many in the country are more focused on navigating a cost-of-living crisis than celebrating a dysfunctional royal family.

title: Paraguay Picks a New President: What You Need to Know
description: The South American nation is deciding between a candidate from the entrenched conservative party and two opposition candidates —an anti-corruption crusader and a far-right firebrand.

title: Paraguay Picks a New President: What You Need to Know
description: The South American nation is deciding between a candidate from the entrenched conservative party and two opposition candidates —an anti-corruption crusader and a far-right firebrand.

title: They Refused to Fight for Russia. The Law Did Not Treat Them Kindly.
description: Since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine, hundreds of Russian men have faced criminal charges for becoming war refuseniks. That has not stopped others from going to unusual lengths to avoid battle.

title: If You Don’t Use Your Land, These Marxists May Take It
description: The Landless Workers Movement organizes Brazil’s poor to take land from the rich. It is perhaps the largest — and most polarizing — social movement in Latin America.
